content.description:
Climb a splitter to the right of

Texas Corner

to a short, right-facing corner and two bolt anchor.
content.location:
This is 80' right of

Texas Corner

.

content.description:
Climb an obvious, left-facing corner behind the

Sunday Stroll

buttress, and use the same anchor as for

SS

and CS.

This awesome finger crack follows obvious splitter up the center of this varnished face surrounded by lime green lichen and plentiful foot holds.

Follow a short corner w/ good gear placements (5.8) onto short slab section w/ a single bolt for protection (5.9). After climbing 35' up and left, join a splitter finger crack for 90 feet. The crack is mostly 1" fingers with the occasional hand pod (see gear recommendations) and climbs at mostly 5.9 and easy 5.10. Near the top, the crack slims and the face holds diminish;  another bolt protects the crux (5.10+).  The anchor is visible from the ground and is located above a small pinion tree on a sizable ledge,  climber's left of the crack.
content.protection:
Gear in Friend sizes:

3/8"-3/4" - 2 each

1"-1.5" - 3 each

2"-3" - 1  each

Small to medium wires

2 bolts.

2 bolt anchor serves Sunday Stroll and

Cinco Domingo

.
content.location: Look for obvious face splitter above the road; the anchors are visible above ledge to the climber's left of the crack.

content.description: Climb a short splitter through double roofs (5.11). Clip bolts as you angle right (5.10), then follow fixed copperheads through groove and additional small roof (A1+) before joining a high splitter and thin finger crack (5.10). There is a 2 bolt anchor up top.
content.location:
This route is clearly visible from the road on its own buttress. It's about 100+ feet looker's left of "

The Ear

" corner.

climbs.name: Pump House Direct
climbs.fa: unknown who did the FA...thought we were the first, but then noticed an anchor up top. This anchor services two climbs, so it's unclear still.

content.description: This climb is river-right and hard to miss as you look across the river from the road just before you reach the main Pump Houe area. Look for diagnosing splitter through calcium streaks. Start atop a ledge ten feet up and climb the obvious splitter crack that diagonals the calcium streaked face. Begin with a 1" finger crack that quickly widens to tight hands (5.10) until it eventually widens farther for short OW pod (5.11). It then slims again (2") before the top. It is well worth the wet feet to get there!
content.protection:
Friend sizing:  1"-1.5" - 3 each; 2"-2.5 - 3 each; 3"-4" - 2 each.

A 2 bolt anchor services this route and the corner next to it.
content.location: This crack is the obvious splitter (across river) that faces up riverÂ…look for calcium streaks after you pull over the first big hill past the campground.

content.description: Climb easy 5th class to ledge and obvious north facing, splitter crack that faces downriver. A decent, well-protected (with the right gear) OW leads to a dirty pod up top (C1).
content.protection: Gear-3"-7". There is a bolted anchor that can be use to descend with a single 60m rope.
content.location: It is at the South end of Pump House Crag facing downriver and easily visible from the road as you head upcanyon.

content.description: Climb a splitter to an angled slab crack and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
This is 300' climber's left of

Sunday Stroll

.

content.description: Climb awesome, thin fingers in right-facing corner (5.11+), and then head up hand crack through a short roof to reach a 2 bolt anchor.
content.protection: Bring many 3/8"-1/2", some 1"-1.5", and a few hand-sizes up to 3.5".
content.location:
This route is on the climber's left side of obvious gully. It's upriver and about 300' from

Rizla's Crack

. Its corner is completely visible from the Red Rocks Simulator Wall. The Ear feature is prominent and obvious.

content.description:
Climb a left-facing corner under large roof just right of the start of

Sunday Stroll

. The gear under the roof is good and 5.9; pass onto the face by climbing out and right with cool exposure and enter varnished face; clip 12 bolts (5.10- for 70'). Mid-way up a 1"-1.5" crack requires a single gear placement. This is super fun and well-protected!
content.location:
It is just left of the obvious splitter,

Sunday Stroll

.

content.description:
This obvious crack faces north and can be seen from the 'Red Rocks' Simulator Wall when looking up river.

Begin with dual, right-facing corners, placing gear and passing one protection bolt as you connect corners. Then follow a splitter through easier roof moves and pods.

Although the FA crew encountered some choss near the upper roof and cleaned it as best we could, there is still some questionable rock. The route protects well and is worth the effort with some excellent moves along the bottom half of the pitch. The switching corner moves are perhaps the best, and a single bolt protests this section well.
content.protection:
2-1/2" (green Aliens),

2-3/4" (yellow Aliens),

3-1"(red Aliens),

2-1.5" (0.75 Camalot),

1-2" (#1 Camalot),

2-3" (#2 Camalot),

1-3.5" (#3 Camalot),

1 protection bolt,

2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
This obvious splitter crack faces north and can be seen from the Red Rocks' Simulator Wall when looking up river. It is located 20 feet climbers right of

The Ear

.
